name: AbegalSmartHome
0:
”Alexa, show the baby room”
”Alexa, show abegal camera”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
With Abegal skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your Abegal connected cameras using your voice. This skill supports the following models*:
- Abegal

Follow the steps below to setup your camera and link your Abegal account:
1. From the Abegal Mobile App, select a suitable name for your camera (i.e., baby room, front door, etc.)
2. From your Alexa App, search for Abegal, enable the skill and link it to your Abegal account by signing in with your Abegal account
3. Discover your cameras by asking Alexa “Discover devices” or by pressing the Discover Devices button in the Alexa app

Once your account is linked, viewing your cameras is supported on Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV, 2nd Gen Fire Stick or Fire Tablets (7th gen and above). To see your camera, just say “Alexa, show the (camera name)”

Some important notes:
• Before connecting to Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot or Fire TV, log in to your Abegal App and go to the camera settings. 
• How to change the name of your Abegal camera: Once the camera has been added to your Abegal account, you can change its name in the Abegal camera settings page. Select a suitable name for your camera, such as “baby room” or “front door.”
• You can view live feeds from Abegal cameras on your Amazon Echo Show or Fire TV by saying the command “Alexa, show the (camera name).”

For additional information and resources, please visit Abegal online at www.abegal.com, or contact our support team at service@abegal.com.
